stories.text:
I'm a United States resident. I attempted to sign up for a $5 droplet today using my personal Discover credit card. DigitalOcean's UI refused to accept the card, simply stating that "something went wrong." I used their PayPal option instead (ugh, PayPal is evil) and PayPal gladly took the same card and charged it. I was able to order my droplet.

I then emailed support and asked them what's going on. I got this reply:

> Due to a disproportionate number of fraudulent transactions originating from your bank or card issuer, we can no longer accept payments from this institution. In this case, you will need to use a different credit card or use PayPal in order to make a payment.

My Discover card is issued by Discover themselves; there is no intermediary or third-party involved. Does this mean DigitalOcean no longer accepts any Discover card? Speculating here, but perhaps Discover themselves or whatever payment processor DigitalOcean uses cut them off from accepting Discover cards?

What gives?
stories.title: DigitalOcean appears to no longer accepts Discover cards
